page.title: 02Scotter's Church and Chapel
page.content: St. Peter's Church and a Methodist Chapel serve Scotter,Scotterthorpe and East Ferry.Parts of the church date from the{12th century.}The chapel was built in{1900}and was one of 4 in the village.The chapel is included in the{ {Scunthorpe circuit}sharing a minister and lay preachers.The church has a resident minister.The church has 3 Sunday services _{Early Communion}at 6.30 a.m,{Parish Communion}at 8.30 a.m and{Evensong}at 6 p.m.Parish Communion being most popular.The chapel has 2 Sunday services at{10.30 a.m}and{6 p.m The morning service being the most popular.Both church and chapel have flourishing Sunday Schools.Also both have Bible Study Groups and Fellowship Groups associated with them.A{Pram and {Pushchair Service}is held fortnightly at the chapel.Average attendance at the Sunday services is about 50.
